result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Dawann L Johnson was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Dawann L Johnson was found guilty of OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: STAYED.  Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 8 years bifurcated sentence.
STAYED.  Conditions, if revoked, are as those outlined in Conditions of Probation.

miscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full-time employment, attend school full-time or engage in combination of employment and school equal to full-time hours.  Must obtain HSED or GED.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.   Not to enter bars, liquor stores or other establishments whose primary business is the sale of alcohol.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court obligations.  Obey all rules and regulations of supervising agent.  Must get agent approval prior to filling prescriptions for addictive medications.  Must attend 7 self-help meetings per week if not employed and 5 per week if working.  Signed verification is to be provided to agent weekly.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes: May participate in ZCI program after serving 120 days

charges.descr: 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety AMENDED FROM 1st-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety

Charges per attached AMENDED criminal complaint. Conditions:  No driving at all.  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any  alcohol.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.  The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  $208 advanced fee for installment of SCRAM must be paid prior to release from jail. Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) to monitor - 524 S Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 5-4-2015:  SCRAM UNIT IS REMOVED.  DEFENDANT IS TO TEST RANDOMLY AT ZCI ONCE PER WEEK.**
